Key Match Events: The Mavericks dominated the Spurs on the interior, especially Daniel Gafford, who exploded for 22 points and 7 rebounds in just 18 minutes off the bench.
Collins put up a respectable line of 20 points and 6 rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: The Spurs need more players who can get by the initial defense and make something happen.
Acquiring more offensive creation should be a focal point for the Spurs as they continue to build the roster.
Post-Match Reflections: The Spurs hung around in the first half thanks to some hot shooting from Julian Champagnie and Chris Paul, but ultimately, they couldn’t create enough offense to stick around with the Mavs.
Games like this are tough to face without your best players, but they are more manageable with improved depth and scoring across the roster.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Stephon Castle showed some of the things that indicate he will be a highly effective player for years to come.
Tre Jones’s first game back from injury wasn’t one to hang his hat on, but he should be a big help once the calvary arrives.
Others: The Spurs were 2-11 in the second game of a back-to-back last season.
The 2025 NBA Draft class features some tantalizing offensive creators to keep an eye on.
